pages.text: $(o)"Help, I've fallen and can't get up!"
pages.title: Fractures [2]: Knockdown

pages.text: In the case of a combatant being stunned when having the Unsteady effect, a stun will be upgraded into a $(#CCCC00)$(l)knockdown$().$(br2)When knocked down, the movement debilitation is upgraded to a complete inability to move, and their hands are bound as usual.$(br2)

This type of improved stun lasts for a longer period of time $(o)(around 2-3 times longer)$() and can carry a different configurable percentage of bonus damage when being struck. $(br)Similarly to a stun, when the enemy is attacked the effects will be purged. Until the full stun time is elapsed, however, they cannot take further posture damage.$(br2)Knockdowns can also be forced through proper use of certain skills such as $(#000000)Trample$(), $(#FF0000)Suplex$() or $(#00FFFF)Throw$(), this is especially useful on larger foes who have a lot more posture than you can deplete at once.
$(l)Not even Ignis is safe from THE SUPLEX.

Similarly to a stun, a knocked down mob is completely disabled and should typically have their AI shut off until it gets back up or its knockdown state is removed on hit.$(br2)Knockdowns are also quite common when taking large amounts of fall damage.$(br2)Knockdowns, being an upgraded stun, are also represented by the trio of stars on the posture widget.
